<p align="justify">
Official project title: "Evaluating the Correctness of Domain-Specific
Threat Modeling Languages"<p>

  - Sotirios Katsikeas
  - Engla Rencelj Ling

  - Mathias Ekstedt
- Status: pending completion :orange_circle:
- Timeline: 2022-2023
- Parent project: [coreLang](https://github.com/KTH-SSAS/coreLang)

### Project links

- post here a list of links to project assets that are not located in the github
  repo

## Description

In this work, we are focusing on providing an answer to the question of evaluation of correctness for MAL-based domain specific threat modeling languages. By comparing the attack simulation results generated by a threat modeling language against human expertâ€™s assessments and against real-world cyber attack data, we aim to provide a way of proving the correctness of such attack simulations. Furthermore, focus is given on the process of comparing those three data sets in order to be able to apply our proposed methodology, not only on our subject, which is coreLang, but on any other domain specific threat modeling language as well.

## Work Products

- [x] Create a solid plan on how this validation should be done
- [x] Create the infrastructure to be used in the validation
- [x] Perform the experiments with the human domain experts
- [x] Analyse the results of the validation
- [x] Author the article
- [ ] Submit the article for publication
- [ ] Article is published

- - - -
This is a project run by the [Software Systems Architecture and Security research
group](https://www.kth.se/nse/research/software-systems-architecture-and-security/)
within the [Division of Network and Systems Engineering](https://kth.se/nse) at
the Department of Computer Science at the School of [Electrical Engineering and
Computer Science](https://www.kth.se/en/eecs) @ [KTH university](https://www.kth.se).

For more of our projects, see the [SSAS page at
github.com](https://github.com/KTH-SSAS).
